_documentation.usage: This file contains all configurable parameters for Monte Carlo agents used in the web interface

parameter_descriptions.name: Display name for the agent
parameter_descriptions.n: Number of Monte Carlo simulations to run per action evaluation
parameter_descriptions.chunk_size: Number of simulations to process in each batch (for performance optimization)
parameter_descriptions.early_stop_margin: Threshold for early stopping when an action is clearly inferior (kept for legacy; LUCB provides a principled alternative)
parameter_descriptions.weighted_sampling: Enable weighted dice sampling based on game patterns
parameter_descriptions.enable_parallel: Enable parallel processing using multiple CPU cores
parameter_descriptions.num_workers: Number of worker processes for parallel execution (null = auto-detect)
parameter_descriptions.enhanced_pruning: Enable advanced action pruning with opponent modeling
parameter_descriptions.variance_reduction: Enable variance reduction techniques using control variates
parameter_descriptions.betting_history_enabled: Track and use betting history for decision making
parameter_descriptions.player_trust_enabled: Enable player trust tracking and learning
parameter_descriptions.trust_learning_rate: Learning rate for updating player trust parameters
parameter_descriptions.history_memory_rounds: Number of historical rounds to remember for analysis
parameter_descriptions.bayesian_sampling: Use Bayesian inference for more accurate dice sampling
parameter_descriptions.call_eval_mode: How to evaluate a 'call': 'rollout' (default), 'analytic_leaf' (fast, experimental), or 'hybrid' (future)
parameter_descriptions.mixture_enabled: Enable mixture of rollout policies (sample a policy per rollout)
parameter_descriptions.mixture_weights: List of weights corresponding to mixture_policies (will be normalized)
parameter_descriptions.mixture_min_weight_floor: Minimum floor weight to avoid zero-probability policies
parameter_descriptions.mixture_depth_schedule: Optional depth-dependent weights (object) â€” leave null to use static weights
parameter_descriptions.confstop_enabled: Enable LUCB confidence-based early stopping for action selection (sequential path)
parameter_descriptions.confstop_delta: Failure probability delta for Empirical-Bernstein bounds (e.g., 0.05)
parameter_descriptions.confstop_min_init: Minimum initial rollouts per action before racing
parameter_descriptions.confstop_batch_size: Number of rollouts to sample per LUCB iteration for selected actions
parameter_descriptions.confstop_max_total_rollouts: Optional cap on total rollouts during selection (null = unlimited)
parameter_descriptions.confstop_max_per_action: Optional cap on rollouts per action during selection (null = unlimited)
parameter_descriptions.confstop_bound_b: Bounded range parameter b for EB bounds (1.0 for probability returns)

performance_notes.n: Higher values = better decisions but slower computation. 100-500 recommended for web play
performance_notes.chunk_size: 8-16 works well for most systems. Larger values may improve performance on multi-core systems
performance_notes.enable_parallel: Recommended for multi-core systems when n > 200
performance_notes.num_workers: Leave null to auto-detect CPU cores. Set manually only if needed
performance_notes.confstop_enabled: When true, the agent may use fewer simulations while selecting the same best action; tune delta/min_init/batch_size for stability
